page.title: 09Saint Helena's Church.
page.content: This monumental but ugly building dominates the Lundy skyline.It was completed in 1897 and fulfilled the dream of the island's owner the Rev. Hudson Grosett Heaven- although it ruined the family financially. The church,far too large for its tiny congregation,has always been more symbolic than practical. Weather damage is very evident with limestains on the brickwork lining and tiles lifting off the floor.However the tradition of worship is maintained -mainly by holiday makers and visiting clerics.The old vestry now has a bed to provide over-night accomodation. When we were there the bleakness of the church was lightened by vases of wild narcissi.One group of children attended evensong and despite the lack of accompaniment they enjoyed the singing and the service.
